name: Trigger

fields.name: isExecuting
fields.description: Returns true if the current context for the Apex code is a trigger, not a Visualforce page, a Web service, or an executeanonymous() API call.

fields.name: isInsert
fields.description: Returns true if this trigger was fired due to an insert operation, from the Salesforce user interface, Apex, or the API.

fields.name: isUpdate
fields.description: Returns true if this trigger was fired due to an update operation, from the Salesforce user interface, Apex, or the API.

fields.name: isDelete
fields.description: Returns true if this trigger was fired due to a delete operation, from the Salesforce user interface, Apex, or the API.

fields.name: isBefore
fields.description: Returns true if this trigger was fired before any record was saved.

fields.name: isAfter
fields.description: Returns true if this trigger was fired after all records were saved.

fields.name: isUndelete
fields.description: Returns true if this trigger was fired after a record is recovered from the Recycle Bin. This recovery can occur after an undelete operation from the Salesforce user interface, Apex, or the API.

fields.name: new
fields.description:
Returns a list of the new versions of the sObject records.

This sObject list is only available in insert, update, and undelete triggers, and the records can only be modified in before triggers.

fields.name: newMap
fields.description:
A map of IDs to the new versions of the sObject records.

This map is only available in before update, after insert, after update, and after undelete triggers.

fields.name: old
fields.description:
Returns a list of the old versions of the sObject records.

This sObject list is only available in update and delete triggers.

fields.name: oldMap
fields.description:
A map of IDs to the old versions of the sObject records.

This map is only available in update and delete triggers.

fields.name: operationType
fields.description:
Returns an enum of type System.TriggerOperation corresponding to the current operation.

Possible values of the System.TriggerOperation enum are: BEFORE_INSERT, BEFORE_UPDATE, BEFORE_DELETE,AFTER_INSERT, AFTER_UPDATE, AFTER_DELETE, and AFTER_UNDELETE. If you vary your programming logic based on different trigger types, consider using the switch statement with different permutations of unique trigger execution enum states.

fields.name: size
fields.description: The total number of records in a trigger invocation, both old and new.

description: Use the Trigger class to access run-time context information in a trigger, such as the type of trigger or the list of sObject records that the trigger operates on.
